Name: Requiring the provision of sexual and reproductive health services by the department of health and mental hygiene.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the provision of sexual and reproductive health services by the department of health and mental hygiene

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
History.AgendaNote: Amended and Coupled on General Orders

History.Description: This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Mayor
History.MinutesNote: This bill was given a Mayoral Public Hearing on  August 29, 2022 but was not signed on that date.  Int. No. 490-A was signed into law by the Mayor on  September 6, 2022.

History.Description: This Introduction was Bill Signing Scheduled by Mayor
This Introduction was Signed Into Law by Mayor
This Introduction was Recved from Mayor by Council

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - June 2, 2022
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - August 11, 2022

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to provide sexual and reproductive health services and conduct research on sexual and reproductive health disparities within the city. In providing such services, the department will have the power and duty to: provide outreach, education, and support to individuals, especially low-income individuals and those without health insurance, regarding issues related to sexual and reproductive health, including but not limited to: contraception, including a broad range of methods such as long-acting reversible contraception; preconception health services; abortion services; family planning services; testing, prevention, and treatment for HIV; testing and treatment for sexually transmitted infections; routine screening for breast and cervical cancer; and health education in community settings to promote reproductive health, to prevent unintended pregnancy, and to promote access to reproductive and preventive health services. The office would also make referrals to affordable and accessible services related to contraception, abortion, family planning, breast and cervical cancer screenings, and counseling, testing, and treatment for HIV and sexually transmitted infections, when determined appropriate by the department.

\ul\v0\par
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. \cf1 Chapter 1 of title 17 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 17-199.19 to read as follows:\par
\ul\'a7 17-199.19 Provision of sexual and reproductive health services. a. \cf0 The department shall provide \cf1 sexual and reproductive health services and \cf0 conduct \cf1 research on sexual and reproductive health disparities within the city. In providing such services, the department shall have the power and duty to:\par
1. Provide outreach, education, and support to individuals, especially low-income individuals and those without health insurance, regarding issues related to sexual and reproductive health, including, but not limited to:\par
(a) Contraception, including a broad range of methods such as long-acting reversible contraception;\par
(b) Preconception health services;\par
(c) Abortion services;\par
(d) Family planning services;\par
(e) Testing, prevention, and treatment for HIV;\par
(f) Testing and treatment for sexually transmitted infections;\par
(g) Routine screening for breast and cervical cancer; and\par
(h) Health education, in community settings, to promote reproductive health, prevent unintended pregnancy, and promote access to reproductive and preventive health services. \par
2. Make referrals, when determined appropriate by the department, to affordable and accessible services related to contraception; abortion; family planning; breast and cervical cancer screenings; and counseling, testing, and treatment for HIV and sexually transmitted infections.\par
\pard\cbpat2\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect 1 year after it becomes law.\par
